subdivision_of_building:
The proposal does not affect any area, its simply changing an existing use to a different use. 
The changes are only materials and cosmetics.
description: Conversion of outdoor covered smoking area to a shisha area with soundproof cover
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out except in complete accordance with the details shown on submitted plan numbers:
Elevations east and west facing Rev 02
and shall thereafter be retained/maintained for as long as the development remains in existence.
To ensure the development complies with the provisions Hillingdon Local Plan Parts 1 (November 2012) and 2 (January 2020) and the London Plan (2021).

The proposed noise insulation and mitigation measures detailed on the hereby approved plans shall be constructed/installed prior to the use of the hereby approved shisha area. Thereafter the noise mitigation and insulation measures shall be maintained and retained throughout the lifetime of the development.
Reason: To protect neighbouring amenities in line with polices DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020) and paragraph 130 of the NPPF (2021).
The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall be as shown on the submitted plans and shall thereafter be retained as such.

To safeguard the visual amenities of the area and to ensure that the proposed development does not have an adverse effect upon the appearance of the existing building in accordance with Policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020).
